snippet: A United Nations report calling on the Vatican to remove all child abusers from its ranks was hailed by victims as a landmark and criticized by church supporters as misguided.
abstract: United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child calls on the Vatican to remove all child abusers from its ranks, report them to law enforcement and open the church’s archives so that bishops and other officials who concealed crimes can be held accountable; Vatican says that it has already made many of the requested changes.

byline.original: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN, NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and JIM YARDLEY
byline.contributor: Laurie Goodstein reported from New York, Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva and Jim Yardley from Rome.

lead_paragraph: A United Nations report calling on the Vatican to remove all child abusers from its ranks was hailed by victims as a landmark and criticized by church supporters as misguided.
